name: SerializedSchedule
documentation:
Represents a scheduled message to be delivered at a specific {@link #timestamp}.

If a schedule with the same {@link #scheduleId} already exists:

  • It will be replaced by this schedule if {@link #ifAbsent} is {@code false} (default behavior).
  • It will be preserved (this one ignored) if {@link #ifAbsent} is {@code true}.
@see io.fluxzero.common.api.scheduling.Schedule

fields.name: ifAbsent
fields.documentation: If {@code true}, the message is only scheduled if no schedule with the same {@link #scheduleId} exists.

fields.name: message
fields.documentation: The message to be dispatched once the schedule triggers.

fields.name: scheduleId
fields.documentation: A unique identifier for this scheduled message. Used for deduplication or replacement.

fields.name: timestamp
fields.documentation: The absolute timestamp (epoch millis) at which this message should be delivered.

methods.name: toMetric
methods.documentation: Returns a lightweight metric representation of this schedule for monitoring purposes.
